remarks:
An axiom scheme of standard predicate calculus that emulates Axiom 5 of [Mendelson] p. 69.  The hypothesis ` F/ x ph ` can be thought of as emulating " ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` ."  With this definition, the meaning of "not free" is less restrictive than the usual textbook definition; for example ` x ` would not (for us) be free in ` x = x ` by ~ nfequid .  This theorem scheme can be proved as a metatheorem of Mendelson's axiom system, even though it is slightly stronger than his Axiom 5.  See ~ stdpc5v for a version requiring fewer axioms. (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-1993.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Oct-2016.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 1-Jan-2018.)

 An axiom scheme of standard predicate calculus that emulates Axiom 5 of [Mendelson] p. 69.  The hypothesis ` F/ x ph ` can be thought of as emulating " ` x ` is not free in ` ph ` ."  With this definition, the meaning of "not free" is less restrictive than the usual textbook definition; for example ` x ` would not (for us) be free in ` x = x ` by ~ nfequid .  This theorem scheme can be proved as a metatheorem of Mendelson's axiom system, even though it is slightly stronger than his Axiom 5.  (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-1993.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 12-Oct-2016.)  (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 1-Jan-2018.)
statement:
stdpc5.1 $e |- F/ x ph $.
stdpc5 $p |- ( A. x ( ph -> ps ) -> ( ph -> A. x ps ) ) $.
